page.title: 13Farming on the Marshes
page.content: There are few farms on the marshes,and most of these are situated to the west of our rectangle.We discovered that the farms main speciality is cattle. They are a mixture between beef and dairy cows.The land is perfect for their eating qualities as the grass is soft,rich, yet firm.The farmers grow very little of crops such as barley or wheat, instead they prefer to concentrate on growing grasses.These grasses are good quality, therefore the farmers feed it to the cows.There are many water channels and passages on the Pevensey Levels, they form the divisions between the fields.One last point is that many fields are owned by farmers who may live some miles away, not all fields are owned by the farms nearest them.
